CONSERVATION & COOPERATION STARTS WITH US!

Casa monarchs are on the move! Did you know that every year millions of monarch butterflies migrate nearly 3,000 miles from the northeastern U.S and Canada to reach their overwintering grounds in southwestern Mexico?

This year Casa Esperanza will participate in a symbolic migration. Students will artistically create butterflies that “fly” to Mexico in the fall and "fly" back home to North Carolina in the spring. Students who live beside the monarchs’ winter sanctuaries in Mexico will protect the paper butterflies our students create and return them to us!

Through this symbolic migration, children are united by the monarch butterfly and celebrate its spectacular journey while they learn authentic lessons of conservation and international cooperation.

QUESTION: Why are Casa students running for BrainPOP in the 2019 Healthy Kids Fun Run?
ANSWER: Curiosity!

Learning materials that spark curiosity are crucial, so we have a variety of traditional Montessori materials in our classrooms and we incorporate technology, too. BrainPOP is an online tool similar to an animated encyclopedia. It offers short lessons and comprehension quizzes on science, social studies, English, math, arts, music, health, and engineering. It’s also available in Spanish! The PFA is dedicated to purchasing a BrainPOP subscription for the 2019 - 2020 school year.

Studies show that students increase their ability to learn and retain information when their curiosity is ignited! The limbic reward system of the brain actually illuminates when students are curious. Our teachers know that it is important to spark curiosity in the classroom as well as use curiosity as a teaching method.

Thanks for supporting the 2019 Healthy Kids Fun Run!

QUESTION: Why are Casa students running for RAZ Kids in the 2019 Healthy Kids Fun Run?
ANSWER: 12 Million!

Building proficiency in reading takes practice! RAZ Kids is a library of online, interactive eBooks at 29 levels of difficulty. It is a favorite tool for students and teachers that makes reading accessible and enjoyable. The PFA is dedicated to purchasing a RAZ Kids subscription for the 2019 - 2020 school year.

Studies show that students who read 30 minutes a day, between kindergarten and twelfth grade, are projected to encounter 13.7 million words before graduation. Students who average less than 15 minutes of reading per day are likely to be exposed to only 1.5 million words. The difference is more than 12 million words!

Thanks for supporting the 2019 Healthy Kids Fun Run!
